name: distastefully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
feeling or showing distaste (= dislike) for something: "I don't like that one," said Betty distastefully. He eyed the armchair distastefully but sat down.
in a way that is unpleasant or unacceptable: Many people found the image distastefully voyeuristic. See
distaste
More examplesFewer examplesHe looked distastefully at the overflowing bins.She pointed distastefully at his filthy vest.He commented (rather distastefully, it must be said) that the murder occurred at just the right time.I found the humour to be distastefully crude.
